DaD.Holder

Class ItemHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • DaD.Holder.ItemHolder

  • public class ItemHolder
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Clovis on 29/05/2017. Singleton used to hold all ItemTemplate into one unique place.
    See Also:
    ItemTemplate

    • Field Detail

      • _instance

        private static final ItemHolder _instance
        Private instance of class.

      • _itemsList

        private final gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<ItemTemplate> _itemsList
        HashMap containing the full ItemTemplate list.

        The key for this HashMap is an Integer and the value is ItemTemplate. The key is equal to the ID of the template, the ID of the template can be found in the item configuration file.

        See Also:
        ItemLoader, ItemTemplate

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemHolder

        private ItemHolder()
        Private constructor of class.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static final ItemHolder getInstance()
        Accessor for private instance of class.
        Returns:
        ItemHolder

      • createTemplate

        public void createTemplate(MultiValueSet itemStat)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a template from a MultiValueSet containing all necessary information.

        Here we receive information about a template, we call the constructor and add the template create to the HashMap.

        Parameters:
        itemStat - MultiValueSet containing the information
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If a template already use ID given in MultiValueSet
        See Also:
        ItemTemplate.ItemTemplate(MultiValueSet)

      • getItem

        public ItemTemplate getItem(int order)
        Return the item who has the given value as ID.

        Here ID given in MultiValueSet and key in the HashMap are the same!

        Parameters:
        order - The ID of the item.
        Returns:
        ItemTemplate

      • getTemplateList

        public gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<ItemTemplate> getTemplateList()
        Return the full HashMap containing all templates.

        The HashMap use an Integer as a key and an ItemTemplate as value.

        Returns:
        HashMap

      • displayAllItems

        public void displayAllItems()
        Display all item in the HashMap by calling the ItemTemplate.displayTemplate() function for each template.
